title: Two Wheels Self-Balancing Robot
description: The aim of the project was to build a wheeled robot, designed with Autodesk Inventor and manufactured using a 3D printer, capable of autonomously maintaining balance. This was achieved by designing a PID controller implemented on an Arduino Nano, able to asymptotically stabilize the system’s equilibrium point.

details.challenge: Accurately measuring the robot’s tilt angle was challenging due to sensor noise. A simple low-pass filter was insufficient, so we implemented a Kalman filter to effectively reduce noise and obtain reliable angle measurements.
details.solution: Designed and implemented a PID controller on Arduino Nano, using data from an MPU6050 IMU sensor. The controller stabilized the robot by continuously adjusting motor outputs based on filtered angle feedback.
